Literature.Title: Pseudocin 196, a novel lantibiotic produced by Bifidobacterium pseudocatenulatum elicits antimicrobial activity against clinically relevant pathogens
Literature.Author: Sanchez-Gallardo R, O'Connor PM, O'Neill IJ, McDonnell B, Lee C, Moore RL, McAuliffe FM, Cotter PD

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Lactococcus lactis subsp. cremoris HP(MIC=0.52µg/ml),Streptococcus dysgalactiae GpB(MIC=2.09µg/ml),Streptococcus agalactiae ATCC 13813(MIC=8.37µg/ml),Romboutsia lituseburensis ATCC 25759(MIC=16.74µg/ml),Clostridium perfringens ATCC 3626(MIC=33.48µg/ml),Lactiplantibacillus plantarum(no activity data),Listeria innocua(no activity data),Enterococcus faecalis(no activity data),Staphylococcus aureus(no activity data),Pseudomonas aeruginosa NCIB 10421(no activity data),Bifidobacterium longum CCUG 52486(no activity data),Bifidobacterium longum subsp. infantis ATCC 15697(no activity data)
